1.text: He that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and without remedy.

2.text: When the righteous increase, the people rejoice; but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.

3.text: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father; but he that is a companion of harlots destroyeth [his] substance.

4.text: A king by just judgment establisheth the land; but he that taketh gifts overthroweth it.

5.text: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his steps.

6.text: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare; but the righteous shall sing and rejoice.

7.text: The righteous taketh knowledge of the cause of the poor; the wicked understandeth not knowledge.

8.text: Scornful men set the city in a flame; but the wise turn away anger.

9.text: If a wise man contendeth with a fool, whether he rage or laugh, [he] hath no rest.

10.text: The bloodthirsty hate the perfect, but the upright care for his soul.

11.text: A fool uttereth all his mind; but a wise [man] keepeth it back.

12.text: If a ruler hearken to lying words, all his servants are wicked.

13.text: The indigent and the oppressor meet together; Jehovah lighteneth the eyes of them both.

14.text: A king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

15.text: The rod and reproof give wisdom; but a child left [to himself] bringeth his mother to shame.

16.text: When the wicked increase, transgression increaseth; but the righteous shall see their fall.

17.text: Chasten thy son, and he shall give thee rest, and shall give delight unto thy soul.

18.text: Where there is no vision the people cast off restraint; but happy is he that keepeth the law.

19.text: A servant is not corrected by words: he understandeth indeed, but he will not answer.

20.text: Hast thou seen a man hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

21.text: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child, shall in the end have him as a son.

22.text: An angry man exciteth contention; and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.

23.text: A man’s pride bringeth him low; but the humble in spirit shall obtain honour.

24.text: Whoso shareth with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth the adjuration, and declareth not.

25.text: The fear of man bringeth a snare; but whoso putteth his confidence in Jehovah is protected.

26.text: Many seek the ruler’s face; but a man’s right judgment is from Jehovah.

27.text: An unjust man is an abomination to the righteous; and he that is of upright way is an abomination to the wicked [man].
